Results._refObjectName: DM metods that can potentially part of core should be moved to core or at least placed in generic DM module.
Results.Description:
_____________________________________________

From: Newcombe, Ian (GE Infra, Energy)

Sent: Wednesday, November 11, 2009 11:34 PM

To: Helliwell, Antony M (GE Infra, Energy); Fell, Chris (GE Infra, Energy, Non-GE); Baig, Tajuddin A (GE Infra, Energy)

Cc: Blume, Jana (GE Infra, Energy)

Subject: RE: DM problem in PNI on Virgo

Yes (actually the 1b patch) and I didn't spot the cross module dependency when I reviewed the patch. Strictly speaking, DLT's should be useable standalone without DM but DM has never been productised to be shipped without DLT's, not that this excuses this.

_____________________________________________

From: Helliwell, Antony M (GE Infra, Energy)

Sent: 11 November 2009 17:44

To: Newcombe, Ian (GE Infra, Energy); Fell, Chris (GE Infra, Energy, Non-GE); Baig, Tajuddin A (GE Infra, Energy)

Cc: Blume, Jana (GE Infra, Energy)

Subject: RE: DM problem in PNI on Virgo

The call seems to have come in as a consequence of a DM412TSB patch - 127830_1a

Anony

_____________________________________________

From: Newcombe, Ian (GE Infra, Energy)

Sent: 11 November 2009 17:37

To: Fell, Chris (GE Infra, Energy, Non-GE); Baig, Tajuddin A (GE Infra, Energy)

Cc: Helliwell, Antony M (GE Infra, Energy); Blume, Jana (GE Infra, Energy)

Subject: RE: DM problem in PNI on Virgo

Yes, an example of poor componentisation in DM. Such generic DM behaviour is a potential candidate for inclusion in Core, otherwise it should be in the module swg_dsn_manager_base (in this case in the module directory source\additions).

Suggest you report it as a DM defect.

Cheers, Ian.

_____________________________________________

From: Fell, Chris (GE Infra, Energy, Non-GE)

Sent: 11 November 2009 14:09

To: Baig, Tajuddin A (GE Infra, Energy); Newcombe, Ian (GE Infra, Energy)

Cc: Helliwell, Antony M (GE Infra, Energy); Blume, Jana (GE Infra, Energy)

Subject: DM problem in PNI on Virgo

 

Hi,

As you know, PNI uses part, but not all, of Design manager; this is managed by requiring a subset of DM modules at build time

It seems that we are missing the method dd_record_and_collection_mixin.prepare_fields_and_values() which I find is defined in gens_layout_tools and used in swg_dsn_admin_engine which doesn't have gens_layout_tools set as a required module

Is it possible that generic methods such as this could have their own module? That way we would not have to load all of gens_layout tools.

Any thoughts?

 

Chris
Results.Name: DM metods that can potentially part of core should be moved to core or at least placed in generic DM module.

Results._refObjectName: IRD CBG00130411 : Able to add the RWOs and Points and spans to the design at intermediate state
Results.Description:
Steps to reproduce :
1. Create a design and add some objects like Pole and Transformer.
2.Make sure the jobserver is not running and transist the design from Design Layout to Approved.
3.Try to create the the point spans and objects .It is allowing to create points and spans and could able to add cos also to it.

Expected Result : When the user trying to insert some objects or some points and spans the insert , update and delete options should be disabled.

Note : The other Intermediate states like Approved to Design Layout and As-built to Post Pending are working as expected like not allowing any additions or updations.

 

Acceptance Criteria

  • When in an intermediate state i.e during a pending transition a User should not be able to insert/update/delete objects of user datasets (gis, electric , gas in UPS Demo) , should not be able to insert/update/delete work points , should not be able to add any cost objects to rwos.
Results.Name: IRD CBG00130411 : Able to add the RWOs and Points and spans to the design at intermediate state
Results.Notes:
Note from Alan - the issue is not "intermediate state" - it's that Approved should be defined in the state model as a read-only state. If it is, there's a problem. I'm not sure that I'd go as far as saying that it is essential that these options should be disabled in a read-only state. That's John's call. In any case, I would NOT classify this as an S2 - I would say S3.

Technical Analysis:

The error is reproducible.But the defect says it is working well for transitions between Approved to Design Layout and As-built to Post Pending,which is wrong. since the states Asbuilt, approved are read only we are not able to insert or update, not because of the job submitted. Moreover,  an Error saying "lwt stack out of synch" occurs during these transitions.

This case should be handled by disabling icons during state transitions, if it is appropriate.

Results._refObjectName: Spike : DM changes with respect to core changes to conflict viewer
Results.Description:
Whenever DM performs a merge or far-merge operation with :operator_inteventiomn conflict resolution mode, DM must integrate with the application's conflict_resolution_setup_manager to allow the application to setup the required Auto Conflict Resolution rules to be used.

(Refer to Notes below for Analysis details).

Acceptance criteria:

A)Vailidate merge

1) Ensure some auto-resolution rules have been configured by XML (need to discuss with Duncan on what test rules he has that we can use).

2) Create two designs D1 and D2 and make a conflicting change in each design on a record for which auto-resolution has been configured.

3) Integrate D1 and then refresh D2.

4) Validate the the auto-configuration rules were applied on the merge.

5) Repeat the test without any rules configured and verify that the user is prompted to resolve the conflict manually.

B)Vailidate far-merge

1) Ensure some auto-resolution rules have been configured by XML (need to discuss with Duncan on what test rules he has that we can use).

2) Create two designs D1 and D2 and make a conflicting change in each design on a record for which auto-resolution has been configured.

3) Permanently combine D1 into D2

4) Validate the the auto-configuration rules were correctly applied on the far-merge to D2.

5) Repeat the test without any rules configured and verify that the user is prompted to resolve the conflict manually.
Results.Name: Spike : DM changes with respect to core changes to conflict viewer
Results.Notes:
Analysis: Ian

Configuration of Auto Conflict resolution is provided by the
class conflict_resolution_setup_manager. This code is still under
development (DM requires the proposed patch P131967_1b).

Prior to performing a vmds merge, from parent_view to child_view,
the following method must be called so that the application can
setup the auto conflict resolution rules required for the merge.

conflict_resolution_setup_manager.configure_engine(
  child_view, parent_view, _gather keys_and_args )

Core provides a backstop implementation and this method may be subclassed by the
application (such as EO or PNI) to setup rules in a design dependent specific way.
(Apparantly some clients require different rules for installation jobs than for
replacement jobs). The keys_and_args are not used by the backstop method, but they
will be used by DM to pass details about the design that is being merged. The
API that DM expects will need to be documented so that EO/PNI can write their
configure_engine() method accordingly. We probably need to pass the following
key, value pairs (I haven't fully thought this through yet):
    Key              Value
    :merge_type      either :far_merge or :merge
    :scheme          swg_dsn_scheme being merged
    :source_scheme   swg_dsn_scheme forr the source scheme
                     being far-merged into :scheme
                     = _unset if :merge_type is :merge

The call to conflict_resolution_setup_manager.configure_engine() will be
made from swg_dsn_vmds_integrator.do_merge() for the case of a normal
database merge and for the case of a combine design operation (which will
be a far-merge for permanent combine with operator conflict resolution). The
case of a far-merge to a distant scheme or CI will always be a forced
conflict resolution in favour of the source scheme. An example of how this
is done is shown by the following version management dialog methods:

   version_manager.set_up_resolver()
   version_manager.action!merge()

This means that swg_dsn_vmds_integrator.do_merge() needs to implement a
method equivalent to the method version_manager.set_up_resolver() and that
the classg swg_dsn_vmds_integrator needs to access the application to get
a handle on the conflict_resolution_setup_manager plugin as foillows:

crs_manager << _self.application.get_service_provider(
          :conflict_resolution_setup_manager )

The instance of the swg_dsn_vmds_integrator class is created by
the following line:

.vmds_integrator << swg_dsn_vmds_integrator.new(a_model)

in method swg_dsn_admin_engine.init(_optional a_model), where
a_model is a pseudo_grs and swg_dsn_vmds_integrator initialises
its .grs slot to the pseudo_grs (a_model) that is passed in.

Instead, swg_dsn_vmds_integrator should be converted to no longer hold
a pseudo_grs but the application that is using it by replacing its
.grs slot with a .application slot and instancing it from the admin
engine with the call:

.vmds_integrator << swg_dsn_vmds_integrator.new(.owner.application)

The current wg_dsn_vmds_integrator.application method should then be
changed to return .application and all calls to _self.grs within
the class should be changed to _self.application.

Results._refObjectName: Always aware if my design is in a design set
Results.Description:
As a designer, on every occasion that I see (the name of) a design listed in the UI, it is obvious to me that that particular design is a member of a design set, because I know that designs that are a members of a set are subject to constraints and restrictions that 'normal' designs are not subject to. This helps me know instantly what I can and can't do with that design.

Acceptance Criteria

  • In Design Browser, if any design displayed in a tree or results is a member of a Design Set, the design name is flagged with the design set name
  • Similarly in Navigator
  • When a design is open, the title bar also indicates whether it is a design set or is IN a design set.

  • For a phase of a design which is in a design set, it's the same as for a design.

    1) In the title bar: "In design set" 2) In the Design Browser: display the design set name in the column.

 

Technical Analysis

Assuming the requirement is to add another column called "Design Set" with values being design set names. This can be possible by modifying the below shared constant

swg_dsn_design_manager.define_shared_constant(
        :field_names_for_display,
        ## Vector of field names to display.  Each item is a
        ## minimum two-element vector
        ##  - :project or :scheme (to identify the table)
        ##  - the field name
        ##  - overriding field width (optional) - if not entered,
        ##    it will be taken from the field
        ## These do not actually have to be fields in the DD - they can
        ## be ordinary methods as well.
        {{:project, :name, 32},
  {:scheme, <method_name>, ,32},
         {:scheme, :fully_qualified_name, 32},
         {:build_phase, :name, 32},
         {:design, :status, 20},
         {:project, :job_title,32}, 
         {:scheme, :owner, 20},
         {:scheme, :geaendert_am, 12}
        }
        ,
        _false)
$

The <method_name> should be a method on swg_dsn_scheme to return the design set name or empty string (if not design set). a meesage with the <method_name> as key shoiuld be defined.

The code that is responsible for displaying the "Full Design Name" column needs to modified as well to only display the design name.
Results.Name: Always aware if my design is in a design set
Results.Notes:
UX NOTES

(THESE ARE FIRST IDEAS, AND NEED DISCUSSION WITH IAN/HTC)

1) In The Design Browser:

A) A new column called "Set". This is after the "Full Design Name" column.
    - If the design is a set, this column displays "Design set". 
    - If it is in a design set, this column displays the design set name. 

2) In the Navigator, use the same solution as (1)

3) In the title bar:

A) For a design set, add ", Design Set" after the read/write status, inside the brackets. For example, for design set DS-Ian-01:

"(Project Design Sets - DS-Ian-01, Design Layout, Writeable, Design Set)"

B) For a design that is IN a design set, add ", In Design Set" after the read/write status, inside the brackets. For example, for design JK-D-01 in project P223:

"(Project P223 - JK-D-01, Design Layout, Writeable, In Design Set)"

Results._refObjectName: Designer can publish COs to as built
Results.Description:
As a designer at SECO, I can instruct the system to publish cost objects (COs and MAs) to as-built because (although most other Smallworld electric utilities do not do this) it is part of our established process, and is useful to us when assessing what to do after a severe storm

UX NOTES

This is a "common work practice" setting, and will go in the TOOLS > OPTIONS for DM.

1) In the OPTIONS window, add a new category: Cost Objects

2) When the Cost Object category is selected, there will be a single option with a check box:

"Include Cost Objects when posting designs"

By default, the check box is unchecked.

NOTE - The capitalisation of this text is significant, so please cut-and-paste when implementing.

Any questions, please contact me. JK

IMPORTANT - the consequences of posting COS to As Built is unclear. SECO needs this information in As Built, but do they want this CO information to be merged down into other designs? JK called Steve Dingman at SECO about this on Wed 25 Nov 2009, and followed up with Barry Owens on Mon 25 January 2010. Barry confirmed that SECO are happy with the proposed implementation.
Results.Name: Designer can publish COs to as built
Results.Notes:
DEV NOTE: Originally this task was created to provide a new optiion to allow the user to allow the user to specify that cost objects are to be integrated to the As-built network. After starting this work and implementing most of the changes I discovered that the system does post CUs to As-built. Follow-up discussion with the client resulted in identifying that we no longer need to implement such an option and the code for the configuration option has now been removed.

All that now remains in this task was a number of tidy up changes made the clearing of tables on integration that were made to account for changes that had been made in the last release (DM412) to remove the ability to cache and restore temporary changes. This has meant deprecating various methods and replacing them with new methods.

In addition, the system was posting work points (only deleting work the point line and work point text geometries) when there is no requirement to post the work points themselves (as is not done for tpublishing changes from a related design). This task has therefore also changed the clearing on integration to now delete the workpoints as well.

Results._refObjectName: Show phase name on job queue when posting phases
Results.Description:
As a user, I want to be able to easily identify the name of a phase being posted on the job queue.

Acceptance Criteria

1) PHASE IN DESIGN
    - Create a phase in a design, and populate it.
    - Take the phase through its lifecycle until it posts. 
    - In the job queue, ensure that the phase name is displayed rather than the project name.
    - Ensure that the phase posts successfully.

2) PHASE IN A DESIGN SET
    - Create a phase in the top-level design set, and populate it.
    - Take the phase through its lifecycle until it posts. 
    - In the job queue, ensure that the phase name is displayed rather than the project name.
    - Ensure that the phase posts successfully.

3) PHASE PROMOTED TO A DESIGN SET
    - Create a phase in a design that is in a design set, and populate it.
    - Publish the changes from the design. This moves the design to the design set.  
    - Take the phase through its lifecycle until it posts. 
    - In the job queue, ensure that the phase name is displayed rather than the project name.
    - Ensure that the phase posts successfully.
Results.Name: Show phase name on job queue when posting phases
Results.Notes:
UX NOTES

When a phase posts, use the job name:

Phase '<Phase>'

For example, when the phase Alpha posts, it appears on the job queue with the following name:

Phase 'Alpha'

Technical Analysis

In the DM application seletc any RWO
In the Editor tab select the Browse button.
Explorer appears.
ALso the following traceback appears which should not.

Results.Name: IRD CBG00131732 :Regression : Traceback on selecting Editor Browse option
Results.Notes:
Technical Analysis:

The recent changes in this area.i.e., dm!network_analysis_plugin registered itself as a consumer of data wth aspect :rwo_set, thus whenever the explorer is populated, it talks to dm!network_analysis_plugin. This should be avoided and the dm!network_analysis_plugin should discriminate results out of trace and the usual explorer results.

Results._refObjectName: Rectify the imapct of GDI+ changes on Design Manager
Results.Description:
Core has introduced an option to display the map with Anti-aliasing and Alpha blending (GDI+). With GDI+ transient data such as DLTs creates more damage to the map than before. But Core also now provides a new mechanism for rendering transient data, so that it does not damage the map.

To fix this regression in map display quality, DM needs to change all transient data drawing code to use the new Core

Acceptance Criteria
  • Demonstrate the use of DLTs prior to the fix; observe the map damage
  • Demonstrate the use of DLTs after the fix; the damage does not occur.
Results.Name: Rectify the imapct of GDI+ changes on Design Manager

Results._refObjectName: EO DM Translator Issue: Booleans in DM Config Assistant not translated
Results.Description:
Goto Design Manager Configuration Assistant ( Configuration Tools > Design Adminstration) > Options Tab. Select 'Project' >  Auto extend Projects on Save > The Boolean values are appearing untranslated.

Acceptance Criteria:

- The boolean values in 'Project' > 'Auto Extend Projects on Save' under 'Design Administration' should populate the translated values under translated environment.
Results.Name: EO DM Translator Issue: Booleans in DM Config Assistant not translated
Results.Notes:
Technical Analysis :

The method 'swg_dsn_cfg_option.external_choice_list(_optional match_string)' should be modified such that it uses the 'Yes' and 'No' messages from a proper message file. Define new messages for Yes and No and use _self.message() call to grab the translated messages.

Test it with the following messages so that after restarting the image 'Yes_Swe' and 'No_Swe' should appear instead of 'Yes' and 'No'.

read_message_patch(:swg_dsn_cfg_option)
$
:Yes :en_gb Yes_Swe
:No  :en_gb No_Swe
$

________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Not Reproducable. Boolean Values are translated in Design Manager Configuration Assistant ( Configuration Tools > Design Adminstration) > Options Tab. Select 'Project' >  Auto extend Projects on Save

The message handler(:swg_dsn_config_manager) used for boolean translations in swg_dsn_cfg_option.magik uses message handler(:gen_garphics). The ids :yes and :no are already present in the gen_graphics.msg file and so no more additions / changes are needed in swg_dsn_config_manager.msg file. The issue is not reproducable after loading the the EO-DM image U:\swdev\streams\virgo\release\sw_office\images\224\sweo_dm_open_upg.msf , applying the language pack by running load_lp.magik. The strings Yes and No are displayed as xxYes and xxNo after running the application which means the strings appearing are translated.

Parent._refObjectName: EPIC: DM things that screw EO

Results._refObjectName: EO DM Translator Issue: Untranslated values appearing in Config Tools window and Job Manager
Results.Description:
Scenario 1:
=======
Goto Configuration Tools window > Project Settings.
a) Observed that the project attributes "= any" are appearing in English strings and hardcoded in the source code.
b) The values in 'Attributes' section are appearing untranslated, when 'Job Project Group' (or) 'Project Owning Group' is selected in Job attributes. The 'Current Settings' are to be checked in EODM application.
In my technical analysis, the following are my findings:
The string "= any" is hardcoded in the following methods, which neds to be avoided.
dw!mgr_default_job_settings.set_job_attributes() and
dw!mgr_default_job_settings.clear_job_attribute()
 

Scenario 2: - Already found the solution - Just needs to be tested

=======

Open 'Job Manager' dialog (System > Administration > Job manager) and the table headers (Name, User, Type etc.,) in 'Processed Jobs' and 'Queued Jobs' are appearing untranslated.

Comments : (added by Swetha)

In my technical analysis, I found that there are two reasons for this -

a) The field names are to be translated in dm_translation_file_creator.magik (specifying sw_job in the file)

  b) Some extra non-visible field names like User, Type are to be translated explicitly. For this, the translator_file_creator.magik needs to be modified.

I have added the required methods to the translator_file_creator.magik, which can be given to EO team to see those field_names appearing translated.

 

Comments: ( Added by Venu)

 

Implementation Notes

-------------------------

1. The project attributes in 'Configuration Tools window > Project Settings' are hard coded in dw!mgr_default_job_settings.magik. All these hardcoded values are defined in the dw!mgr_default_job_settings.msg. The code in dw!mgr_default_job_settings.magik is updated to load the

strings from the dw!mgr_default_job_settings.msg file.

 

2. Selecting the 'Job - Project Group = any' or 'Job - Owning Group = any' in the project attributes list displayed the "Attribute choices" ( ex - CU Users, CU Administrators) as untranslated in the EO DM translated image. The Project Group and Owning Group attribute choices are loaded from the auth!group  ( field - group_name) of the auth_view and the current mechanism does not translate the collections of swg_dsn_auth_system.auth_view.  Along with the auth_group :swg_dsn!swg_dsn_right_auth_group collection and its field group_name also

needs to be translated

 

The dm_translation_file_creator.magik and translation_file_creator.magik are modfied to include the auth_view collections translation.

In the attached code only the collection auth!group and its field group_name is included. The translation files generated from these files can be loaded in the EO DM image. This will resolve the issue.

 

 

 

 

 

Acceptance Criteria:

- The project attributes in 'Configuration Tools window > Project Settings' should appear translated under translated environment. 

- The values in 'Attributes' section should appear translated, when 'Job Project Group' (or) 'Project Owning Group' is selected in Job attributes. [[The 'Current Settings' should also be verified in translated EODM application.]]

- On opening the 'Job Manager' dialog (System > Administration > Job manager) and the table headers (Name, User, Type etc.,) in 'Processed Jobs' and 'Queued Jobs' should appear translated.
Results.Name: EO DM Translator Issue: Untranslated values appearing in Config Tools window and Job Manager
Results.Notes:
Technical Analysis Notes  : Please refer to the description section

Resoulution Notes for Job Manager issue :(Added by Swetha)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Job Manager translation issue can be resolved by following steps a,b and c.
a) by adding ':job_queue' dataset to the' l_target_dataset' in  the 'dm_translation_file_creator.magik'.
b) by adding to ':sw_job,{:name,:status}' to the  'field_value_trn_table 'in 'dm_translation_file_creator.magik'. (If any of the other field values are appearing untranslated, we have to the add those field names along with name and status)
c) The translation_file_creator will translate only the visible fields of a collection. So only, its not translating the fields of sw_job like 'User', 'Outcome Summary', etc.,.
In order to translate such extra field names of any collection, few new methods/changes have been introduced in the dm_translation_file_creator.magik  and translation_file_creator.magik. (by which a new .trn file has been file (attached) "extra_external_name_translations.trn").
When this translation file is loaded, the job manager issue gets resolved.
Note : To provide extra external field names, l_extra_external_field_names_trn_table is to be used.
Eg. Usage:  l_extra_external_field_names_trn_table << property_list.new_with(:sw_job,{:user,:type_name,:submitted,:started,:server,:id,:repeats?,:outcome_summary,:ended}) is to be given in dm_translation_file_creator.magik.
----------------------------------------------------------------------

Parent._refObjectName: EPIC: DM things that screw EO

Results._refObjectName: EO DM Translator Issue: Untranslated values in 'CO Organiser' and 'Points and Spans' Tabs.
Results.Description:
Scenario and Technical Analysis Notes:

Open 'CO Organiser' Tab (or) 'CO section under Points and Spans Tab'.

Observed that the Operations (All, Install etc.,) and Groups (35 KPA METER SETS etc.,) are appearing untranslated.

For this the appropriated collections - dw!cu_group = for group cost_object_library.cost_object_operation_names = for operations needs to be translated. Similarly, while fixing this issue, it worth checking the 'Design Cos', 'Favorites' tab etc., - To be fixed by providing the appropriate collection names in dm_translation_file_creator.magik

Acceptance Criteria:

- All the drop-down fields in All COs Tab such as Operations (All, Install etc.,) and Groups (35 KPA METER SETS etc.,) should appear translated in translated environment/application.

- There should not be any untranslated values shown in other tabs like Design Cos, Favourites etc.,

- The transaltions should also be shown in other CO related dialogs like CO Selector, CO Organiser, etc., where ever COs and their related stuff are populated.
Results.Name: EO DM Translator Issue: Untranslated values in 'CO Organiser' and 'Points and Spans' Tabs.
Results.Notes: Technical Analysis Notes: Please refer t the descrption section. It mentions, which colections are to be checked for translations.

Results._refObjectName: CRD CBG00131406:Traceback for child DLTs
Results.Description:
Hi,

FPL is getting tracebacks when using a DLT that places child objects. I cannot get this to reproduce in an EO image (using UPS is not useful).

What looks to be happening is that the process_for_join() method is getting called on the child dw!record_placement_wizard as part of the notification of the parent (dw!chain_wizard).

I was able to get around this by adding the following to the process_for_join() method. The DLTs seems to work and create the joins correctly upon completion:

_pragma(classify_level=restricted, topic={Design_Wizards}, usage={internal})
_method dw!record_placement_wizard.process_for_join(child_tr,parent_tr)

_if child_tr _is _unset
_then
_return
_endif
<rest of code>
_endmethod
$



The traceback is happening in dw!record_placement_wizard.process_for_join(), which checks if there is a database join relationship between between the child and the parent rwo types. This is not the case for this DLT.

What the problem is that when this method is invoked, the first arguement is unset. I believe that the method in some cases is getting called to early in the process, ie the parent transactions have been set, but the child ones have not been set.


I do not have steps to reproduce the traceback so far.

Regards,
Raluca
Hi Raluca,

I am attaching the Proposed fix and we have not done any Regression testing with this Patch.
Since the Repro steps were not proper and no one at SSG Side and Services side are able to reproduce, we have comeup with a Proposed fix. Please could you test this at your environment and let us know , if this solved the problem or created any new Regression.

Regards,
Sudha
Results.Name: CRD CBG00131406:Traceback for child DLTs
Results.Notes:

===== State: InProgress by: canavast at 2009-12-16 20:18:12 =====
This is definitely a problem reviewing the traceback and doing a code review.

The suggested fix is probably the best idea, as it would not only fix all existing problems areas, but any new code that would use and call this method.  The method should test that parameters are good before it uses them.

The other option is to do error checking on the parameters passed in from the calling method, which is being done in roughly half the time.  This would not  however guarantee that future development wouldn't put this problem right back in.  Good development practices would have this methed check parameters before it uses them.
